TopicTitle: A clock somewhere that tells you how long ago your last quick save/auto save was.

Articles.Content:
I think this should be added, mainly for when people screw up (like me).

So the story goes like this, I had just spent a week building my space stations and bases on various planets, then a rocket that I decoupled came back to haunt me, and smashed though my station, so in panic I quick load and BAM! back to my first flight in this save.

when I press F9 I want a 'Are you sure you want to revert to your last quick save that was '##:##' Hours ago.'

Doesant it already tell you that? It says revert to launch (XXXX seconds ago) or revert to last autosave (XXXX seconds ago). Unless you have bad memory or just suck at math you have no excuse for not being able to remember what you was doing about 10 mins ago.
Maybe he pressed F9 (Which he did) and then there is no confirmation.
Yeah, im not talking about the revert flight button, im talking about the F5 and the F9

Time doesn't really tell you much in reference to space. I'd be better (IMO) if it told you your current state relative to the current body's SOI you are in (i.e. orbiting the sun, escaping Kerbin, etc).

That would be also a really good addition to revert flight button - for now it is just a "Revert to launch" and "Revert to editor", why not add a "Revert to quicksave" and "Revert to autosave"? - it would be really convenient feature to have.

I am in agreement.
